doc: Zwave.JS - Everspring HAC01/Eminent EM6514 Wall Remotes not creating entities/events in Home Assistant
### The problem
Took this weekend to finally move my old Zwave integration to Zwave.js. Overall the network is much more responsive, so great job!

I do, however, have an issue with the Zwave in wall remote (on/off switches basically), both are Eminent EM6514 switches or better known as Everspring HAC01. These devices are added succesfully by the Zwave.js integration, however no entities are created and I also don't see any events on toggling the switches.
From the add-on log I only see this:
`2021-04-11T13:13:31.938Z CNTRLR   [Node 019] treating BasicCC::Set as a report
2021-04-11T13:13:32.367Z CNTRLR   [Node 019] treating BasicCC::Set as a report
2021-04-11T13:13:32.414Z CNTRLR   [Node 019] treating BasicCC::Set as a report
2021-04-11T13:13:32.483Z CNTRLR   [Node 019] treating BasicCC::Set as a report
2021-04-11T13:14:14.003Z CNTRLR   [Node 019] treating BasicCC::Set as a report
2021-04-11T13:14:15.653Z CNTRLR   [Node 019] treating BasicCC::Set as a report
2021-04-11T13:14:38.378Z CNTRLR   [Node 019] treating BasicCC::Set as a report
2021-04-11T13:14:39.656Z CNTRLR   [Node 019] treating BasicCC::Set as a report
2021-04-11T13:14:40.222Z CNTRLR   [Node 019] treating BasicCC::Set as a report
2021-04-11T13:14:40.248Z CNTRLR   [Node 019] treating BasicCC::Set as a report
2021-04-11T13:14:40.273Z CNTRLR   [Node 019] treating BasicCC::Set as a report
2021-04-11T13:14:40.299Z CNTRLR   [Node 019] treating BasicCC::Set as a report
2021-04-11T13:14:40.364Z CNTRLR   [Node 019] treating BasicCC::Set as a report
2021-04-11T13:14:40.405Z CNTRLR   [Node 019] treating BasicCC::Set as a report
2021-04-11T13:14:40.794Z CNTRLR   [Node 019] treating BasicCC::Set as a report
2021-04-11T13:14:40.840Z CNTRLR   [Node 019] treating BasicCC::Set as a report`

So I'm not sure how to get these switches working properly and if this is a bug in the add-on or not? According to here: https://devices.zwave-js.io/ (search for HAC01) the device configuration does exist in the Zwave.js library.
Any troubleshooting on this would be appreciated! :)
